meanings.definition: A three-dimensional miniature or life-size scene in which figures, stuffed wildlife, or other objects are arranged in a naturalistic setting against a painted background.
meanings.sent1: The school project involved creating a diorama of a forest with animals and trees.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a beautiful diorama of a historical battle.
meanings.sent3: The diorama of the jungle made the classroom feel like a wild adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a peaceful diorama of a countryside painting.
meanings.sent5: The diorama of the ocean was so realistic, it felt like you could dive in.

meanings.definition: A scene produced by the rearrangement of lighting effects.
meanings.sent1: The theater used a diorama to create a magical forest on stage.
meanings.sent2: The photographer experimented with different dioramas to capture unique shadows.
meanings.sent3: The diorama of the city at night looked like a twinkling wonderland.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a diorama of warm colors.
meanings.sent5: The diorama of the moonlit lake was breathtaking under the stars.
